title: Should turrets do more damage? Poll included
body:
As of the last few months I've been noticing and a lot of others have been saying the same thing. Turrets just don't do enough damage. A mid mage shouldn't be able to tank 5 shots and live to see the day. A turret should be something that is feared. That you are going to be risking you life if your in there too long.  It seems to me that any champ with 1/2 health can lollygag in there tank turret shots and not even worry.

I think they should be feared as a scary obstacle and I agree they should do more damage. If your not in and out to get a kill say goodbye jabroni hope it was worth. 

(Atleast the increase amplification damage on consecutive hits so its harder for tanks to *tank* turrets)

Thoughts?

I'd like to see some huge buffs to inhib and nexus turrets.  I'm completely fine with jax/udyr taking out the first 2 turrets in 30 sec of splitpushing, but I don't think splitpushers should be able to quickly take out inhib turrets.

Here's my idea.
Outer turrets unchanged (even a behind team should be able to take out an outer turret).
Inner turrets.  Give back that champ shield out of combat thingy from a couple seasons ago.  +50% damage and health.
Inhib turrets.  Take 50% reduced damage while less than 2 enemy champs are nearby. +100% health and damage.  Lazer attacks with 50% arpen.
Nexus turrets.  Deal 50% normal damage to minions in a 75 unit radius around its primary target, uses lazer attacks.  +100% damage.
I say yes. Turrets are strong for the first 10 minutes, but they don't scale well ENOUGH into the late game.

I'd like to see 2 things done with towers. First I'd like them to do more damage in the early game, late game dives are fine but early game it should take more than just 1 champ and a minion wave. Second I'd like them to make it so that if a champion is targeted by a turret, then the turret is guaranteed 1 shot at them. This is to help those that are forced under tower early so that they can farm more safely without getting harassed.
